intro: Pentacyphus andinus, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adapted to the harsh conditions of the Andes Mountains. It features opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
